Title: Necessity is the Mother of Invention Ep.4
SubTitle: No Translation

Text: And...it's...done!

Late on the fifth night, right when she'd probably
be diving into another all-nighter, Eta jumps to
her feet, knocking her chair over.

As if right on cue, Epsilon comes knocking, carrying
a basin of warm water and a fresh towel.
Eta?
It's...perfect. Absolutely...perfect!
Don't tell me...you finished it?!
Yeah!
Eta swings around to the door.
You've come...just at the...right time.
I'll show you...what it...can do.
A-Alright. Thank you.

Before that...are you sure you're okay? Your eyes are
bloodshot...
I'm...fine.

I'm...so excited...I don't feel sleepy...at all.
And my heart...is beating...really fast!
Well, seems you're aware—
STOP!

Eta's voice freezes Epsilon in place at the door,
just as she is about to come further in.
Just...stay there.
You want me to stand right here, then.

...Yeah. This is...my new...invention. An...automatic
cart...equipped with...magic circuits.
Automatic? You mean...it'll move by itself?!

As Eta operates the controller in her hands, the cart
starts to move.

Seeing the results of Eta's research, Epsilon's eyes
sparkle, and she shivers in excitement.
That's amazing!
Really, really amazing!
Yeah.
We've got to show everyone! At once!
Just wait here. I'll go call them all over!

Epsilon dashes out of the laboratory almost before
the words leave her mouth.

Aside from those out on a mission, the Seven Shadows
are now gathered in Eta's laboratory.

I can't see the floor again. Even though I cleaned up
for you just a few days ago...
Whoa...there's a dried out apple over here...

She's unveiling her new invention, right? We could
have done it somewhere else...

The thing is, Lady Alpha, this place is the most fitting
location for presenting this particular invention!
Yeah?
It really is! Alright, Eta, let's get started!
Yeah.

With Epsilon—who appears even more excited than
the inventor herself—off to one side, Eta brings the
cart out in front of her three other compatriots.
I added magic circuits...to the cart's wheels...

It'll be useful...for getting things...you need...when
you don't...want to move.

And it's connected...to this controller...in my hand.
With this...you can move it...forward and back...and
left and right.

What's more, it's really high performance, so you can
use it anywhere!

Even here, in Eta's lab, which you wouldn't even call
tidy just to be polite!

Responding to the look that Epsilon throws her way,
Eta gets the cart moving, the washing basin situated
on top.

No way! Even though it's bumping into and rolling
over the objects scattered on the floor, the water
in the basin isn't spilling over at all!

I've used slimes...for the cart racks...which gives
them...extra stability.

It's quieter than a normal cart, too! It doesn't hurt
your ears at all!
Noise...was completely...out of the question.

Given its singular function, it feels like something
designed for the lazy... But it's a really versatile
invention.

If you run magic power...through it...it'll come...
to you. Easy.

I'm sure it'll sell! Add a few more features for the
general public... I'll look into what we'll need for
mass produc—
I bet it'd be fun to ride on it!
Can I try it?! It won't break?!

In terms of...durability...this cart can't...handle it.
But...I'll make...an improved one...that can.
Hurray!
What do you think, Lady Alpha?
It really is an excellent invention.

If it can be operated from afar, and with the noise
reduced to an absolute minimum, it may be useful
on a range of missions.

Indeed! I had exactly the same thought! Though of
course, I'll leave it entirely up to you to determine
how we should use it.
Sure. I'll think of some fitting scenarios.
*yaaaawn*

Having received a more or less positive reaction,
and with both research and presentation complete,
Eta lets out a huge yawn.
I'm...sleepy.

As Eta rubs her eyes, Gamma stops the exuberant Delta
as she tries to climb onto the cart behind its creator's back.

Amidst the laboratory in an unusual state of uproar,
Eta shuffles towards her bed.

Now, I understand that this is a wonderful invention,
but what of the research I asked you to do?
(I feel like...I've forgotten something...)
(Like...research that someone...asked me to do...)

But with sleep invading her mind, Eta can no longer
pursue any complex thoughts...
*yaaaawn*
(...Oh well...)
Eta pretends that she did not hear anything.

Toppling onto the bed, she soon lets out the
gentlest of snores.
Hang on. Eta?

Um! Lady Alpha! Eta has pulled four all-nighters for
this—if we keep her up any longer, it'll be the fifth
one!
Yeah?

There's really no helping it, is there? Do tell her not
to push herself so hard.
I will!
Delta, Gamma, that's enough for now.
U-Understood!
Ha-ruff...

We'll have to come up with ways to use this
technology. Come along now, you two.

And with that, the three of them leave, taking the
cart with them. Left behind, Epsilon goes up to
the girl slumbering in the bed.

I hope you noticed, but Lady Alpha was incredibly
pleased. Far more than her words of praise
suggested.
Hehehe. You really are amazing, Eta.

Smiling gently, Epsilon strokes Eta's head and then
leaves the laboratory.

After spending one and a half days catching up on
her sleep, Eta's eyes spring open.
The researach...that Lady Alpha...asked of me.

She hadn't forgotten what had been asked of her,
after all. It just so happened that she'd had other
research of far greater importance to finish first.
The sample...that I'd...half finished...

Looking around from her position lying in bed,
Eta spots the half-finished sample that she'd
left a short distance away.
Yeah.

While lying in place, Eta modifies the shape of the
slime next to her pillow and extends the it towards
the sample.
I...should have just done...this.
